```{r load-libraries, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE, echo=FALSE}
library(PerformanceAnalytics) #Econometric tools for performance and risk analysis
library(TTR) #Functions to create Technical Trading Rules
library(skimr)
```

First we import data "managers", and extract monthly return of S&P 500. We have in total 132 observations ranging from 1996/1/31 to 2006/12/31, the mean is 0.00867, and the standard deviation is 0.0433.
```{r load_sp500_return_data}
data("managers")
sp500_return <- managers$`SP500 TR`
skim(sp500_return)
```

Now let's plot the monthly returns for S&P 500. 
```{r plot_sp500_return_time_series}
plot(sp500_return * 100,
     main="S&P 500: 1-month % returns",
     ylab="return", xlab="date")

```

To build the index, we calculate cumulative returns for S&P 500 and draw a plot accordingly.
```{r index}
sp500_index <- cumprod(1 + sp500_return) #Cumulative Sums, Products, and Extremes
plot(sp500_index,
     main="S&P 500 Index",
     ylab="price", xlab="date")
```

```{r}
sp500.ret <-ROC(sp500.index, 1, "discrete", na.pad=FALSE)

data.test <-cbind(managers$SP500, sp500.ret)
colnames(data.test)[2] <-c("sp500.ret.ttr")
head(data.test)

sp500.12mo.ret <-ROC(sp500.index, n=12, "discrete", na.pad=FALSE)
```
